Row sums for selected columns with NA handling

Source: R/math.R
row_sums_across.Rd

This function calculates row sums for selected columns using tidyselect expressions. Unlike rowSums, it returns NA rather than 0 when na.rm = TRUE and all selected columns are NA.

Usage

row_sums_across(cols, na.rm = FALSE)

Arguments

cols

<tidy-select> columns to sum across.

na.rm

Should missing values (including NaN) be removed?

Examples

df <- tibble::tibble(
  x = c(1, 2, NA, NA),
  y = c(5, NA, 7, NA),
  z = c(9, 10, 11, NA)
)

df %>%
  dplyr::mutate(
    row_sums = row_sums_across(x:z),
    row_sums_na.rm = row_sums_across(x:z, na.rm = TRUE)
  )
#> # A tibble: 4 × 5
#>       x     y     z row_sums row_sums_na.rm
#>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl>          <dbl>
#> 1     1     5     9       15             15
#> 2     2    NA    10       NA             12
#> 3    NA     7    11       NA             18
#> 4    NA    NA    NA       NA             NA
